job_description: Sr. R&D Engineer - Algorithm - job post AlignTech 160 reviews 2820 Orchard Parkway, San Jose, CA 95134 $183,000 - $208,600 a year -  Internship AlignTech 160 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $183,000 - $208,600 a year Job Type Internship Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About this opportunity Sr. R&D Engineer - Algorithm will be a key member of the R&D team. The Sr. R&D Engineer is responsible for planning, leading, and executing projects focusing on the design and development of new products from concept to technical feasibility. He/she is a creative and innovative thinker motivated by curiosity with a proven record of accomplishments. The Sr. R&D Engineer will provide technical leadership to engineering team in the strategic direction of the product development group. The success of this position will be measured by the success of the team in advancing technology development and launching new products in market. In this role, you will… Design, build, and develop prototype solutions that demonstrate proof-of-concept and early technical feasibility. Develop algorithms to extract information from physiological signals and data. Design algorithm for classification, filtering, signal processing or control. Prototype novel embedded algorithms for wearable sensors. Perform statistical data analysis and interpretation, and present complex data. Work across multiple disciplines (mechanical, electrical, software). Participate in full cycles of product design, prototyping, clinical study, and market launch. Collaborate with cross-functional teams in creating product development and test plans. Duties will also include general engineering support in R&D. Communicate with professionals in the field at all levels and transition information into product development and improvement. In this role, you’ll need … BS with 8+ years, MS with 5+ years, PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science; other scientific disciplines considered. Experience in algorithm development with C/C++, Python, and/or Matlab. Hands-on experience in developing sensing algorithms for inertial sensors, acoustic sensors, imaging sensors, and/or similar sensors. Experience in signal processing and algorithms for time-series data. Technical knowledge and background experience in embedded C. Ability to formulate creative solutions through analyzing complex data. Ability to model, simulate, and verify against empirical data. Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning, linear and nonlinear optimization techniques, and data analysis and visualization tools is a plus. User interface design, graphics programming, or linguistic modeling is a plus. Mobile app development (android, iOS) experience is a plus. Firmware development experience is a plus. Team player, strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Excellent problem-solving skills, thoroughness, attention to detail. Strong interpersonal, oral, written, and visual communication skills, with ability to present findings concisely and effectively. Able to prioritize multiple tasks, manage conflicting deadlines, and work effectively in a dynamic environment. Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. About Align Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives . Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. Global Diversity Statement: At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time. Equal Opportunity Statement It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Primary Location Base Salary Range: $183,000 to $208,600 USD Base salary ranges are a guideline used to determine appropriate pay. Placement depends on the individual skills and experience level of a candidate plus the total compensation and equity across team members. For other locations outside of the primary location, the base salary range will be adjusted geographically. For field Sales roles, the salary listed is the base pay only and does not include the applicable commission plan. A cost of living adjustment may be added to base pay for higher cost areas in the U.S. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.
